alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:50AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of Duck Creek and it`s tributaries will continue this afternoon and linger tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM EST, The automated gauge on Duck Creek in Whipple was at 12.5 feet and remains in minor flood. At stages of 12 feet, the intersection of Kohl Road and Whipple Run Road flood due to backwater flooding. In addition, Route 16 floods above Stanleyville. - Rain will overspread the area once again later this afternoon and evening with an additional 0.5 to 0.75 inches possible. This is expected to introduce another rise along Duck Creek and it`s tributaries tonight which would prolong the minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whipple and Stanleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
